titleStmt.title: To CHARLES SABINE,Charles Sabine (1796-1859), solicitor and poet, of Oswestry, Shropshire. Friend and school-fellow at Mill Hill of CDâ€™s friend Thomas Talfourd. Uncle of Shirley Brooks, of Punch, who served articles with him 1830-3. Published The Council of Constance, 1848, besides Sylva Sacra, 1853, The Jewel and Star, 1855, and other mainly religious verse. A strong Evangelical, he believed fervently in Christ's second coming and laid a place for Him at every meal (see G. S. Layard, A Great 'Punch' Editor, 1907, p. 10; Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 475n). 24 APRIL 1849

body.p: Accept my thanks for your bookProbably The Council of Constance, 1848. Sabine had already sent CD A Little Book for Our Poor Little People, his 1849 vol. of poems; see Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 475, and n. and note, and believe me
